register.name: CFG
register.description: USART Configuration register. Basic USART configuration settings that typically are not changed during operation

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: USART Enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART is disabled and the internal state machine and counters are reset. While Enable = 0, all USART interrupts and DMA transfers are disabled. When Enable is set again, CFG and most other control bits remain unchanged. For instance, when re-enabled, the USART will immediately generate a TxRdy interrupt (if enabled in the INTENSET register) or a DMA transfer request because the transmitter has been reset and is therefore available

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART is enabled for operation

field.name: DATALEN
field.description: Selects the data size for the USART

enumeratedValue.name: 7_BIT_DATA_LENGTH
enumeratedValue.description: 7 bit Data length

enumeratedValue.name: 8_BIT_DATA_LENGTH
enumeratedValue.description: 8 bit Data length

enumeratedValue.name: 9_BIT_DATA_LENGTH
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bit data length. The 9th bit is commonly used for addressing in multidrop mode. See the ADDRDET bit in the CTL register

enumeratedValue.name: RESERVED
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

field.name: PARITYSEL
field.description: Selects what type of parity is used by the USART

enumeratedValue.name: NO_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: No parity

enumeratedValue.name: RESERVED
enumeratedValue.description: Reserved

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Even parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is even, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be even

enumeratedValue.name: ODD_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Odd parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is odd, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be odd

field.name: STOPLEN
field.description: Number of stop bits appended to transmitted data. Only a single stop bit is required for received data

enumeratedValue.name: 1_STOP_BIT
enumeratedValue.description: 1 stop bit

enumeratedValue.name: 2_STOP_BITS
enumeratedValue.description: 2 stop bits. This setting should only be used for asynchronous communication

field.name: CTSEN
field.description: CTS Enable. Determines whether CTS is used for flow control. CTS can be from the input pin, or from the USART's own RTS if loopback mode is enabled

enumeratedValue.name: NO_FLOW_CONTROL
enumeratedValue.description: No flow control. The transmitter does not receive any automatic flow control signal

enumeratedValue.name: FLOW_CONTROL_ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Flow control enabled. The transmitter uses the CTS input (or RTS output in loopback mode) for flow control purposes

field.name: SYNCEN
field.description: Selects synchronous or asynchronous operation

enumeratedValue.name: ASYNCHRONOUS_MODE_IS
enumeratedValue.description: Asynchronous mode is selected

enumeratedValue.name: SYNCHRONOUS_MODE_IS
enumeratedValue.description: Synchronous mode is selected

field.name: CLKPOL
field.description: Selects the clock polarity and sampling edge of received data in synchronous mode

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Falling edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the falling edge of SCLK

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Rising edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the rising edge of SCLK

field.name: SYNCMST
field.description: Synchronous mode Master select

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a slave

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: Master. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a master

field.name: LOOP
field.description: Selects data loopback mode

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL_OPERATION
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation

enumeratedValue.name: LOOPBACK_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback mode. This provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing for USART data. Serial data from the transmitter (Un_TXD) is connected internally to serial input of the receive (Un_RXD). Un_TXD and Un_RTS activity will also appear on external pins if these functions are configured to appear on device pins. The receiver RTS signal is also looped back to CTS and performs flow control if enabled by CTSEN

field.name: OETA
field.description: Output Enable Turnaround time enable for RS-485 operation

enumeratedValue.name: DEASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Deasserted. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal deasserted at the end of the last stop bit of a transmission

enumeratedValue.name: ASSERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Asserted. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal remains asserted for 1 character time after then end the last stop bit of a transmission. OE will also remain asserted if another transmit begins before it is deasserted

field.name: AUTOADDR
field.description: Automatic Address matching enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by software. This provides the possibility of versatile addressing (e.g. respond to more than one address)

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by hardware, using the value in the ADDR register as the address to match

field.name: OESEL
field.description: Output Enable Select

enumeratedValue.name: FLOW_CONTROL
enumeratedValue.description: Flow control. The RTS signal is used as the standard flow control function

enumeratedValue.name: OUTPUT_ENABLE
enumeratedValue.description: Output enable. The RTS signal is taken over in order to provide an output enable signal to control an RS-485 transceiver

field.name: OEPOL
field.description: Output Enable Polarity

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active low

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active high

field.name: RXPOL
field.description: Receive data polarity

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_CHANGED
enumeratedValue.description: Not changed. The RX signal is used as it arrives from the pin. This means that the RX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The RX signal is inverted before being used by the UART. This means that the RX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0

field.name: TXPOL
field.description: Transmit data polarity

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_CHANGED
enumeratedValue.description: Not changed. The TX signal is sent out without change. This means that the TX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The TX signal is inverted by the UART before being sent out. This means that the TX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0

register.name: CTL
register.description: USART Control register. USART control settings that are more likely to change during operation

field.name: TXBRKEN
field.description: Break Enable

enumeratedValue.name: NORMAL_OPERATION
enumeratedValue.description: Normal operation

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUOUS_BREAK_IS
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous break is sent immediately when this bit is set, and remains until this bit is cleared. A break may be sent without danger of corrupting any currently transmitting character if the transmitter is first disabled (TXDIS in CTL is set) and then waiting for the transmitter to be disabled (TXDISINT in STAT = 1) before writing 1 to TXBRKEN

field.name: ADDRDET
field.description: Enable address detect mode

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART presents all incoming data

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART receiver ignores incoming data that does not have the most significant bit of the data (typically the 9th bit) = 1. When the data MSB bit = 1, the receiver treats the incoming data normally, generating a received data interrupt. Software can then check the data to see if this is an address that should be handled. If it is, the ADDRDET bit is cleared by software and further incoming data is handled normally

field.name: TXDIS
field.description: Transmit Disable

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Not disabled. USART transmitter is not disabled

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART transmitter is disabled after any character currently being transmitted is complete. This feature can be used to facilitate software flow control

field.name: CC
field.description: Continuous Clock generation. By default, SCLK is only output while data is being transmitted in synchronous mode

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCK_ON_CHARACTER
enumeratedValue.description: Clock on character. In synchronous mode, SCLK cycles only when characters are being sent on Un_TXD or to complete a character that is being received

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINUOUS_CLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous clock. SCLK runs continuously in synchronous mode, allowing characters to be received on Un_RxD independently from transmission on Un_TXD)

field.name: CLRCCONRX
field.description: Clear Continuous Clock

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT_ON_THE_CC
enumeratedValue.description: No effect on the CC bit

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Auto-clear. The CC bit is automatically cleared when a complete character has been received. This bit is cleared at the same time

field.name: AUTOBAUD
field.description: Autobaud enable

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. UART is in normal operating mode

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. UART is in autobaud mode. This bit should only be set when the UART is enabled in the CFG register and the UART receiver is idle. The first start bit of RX is measured and used the update the BRG register to match the received data rate. AUTOBAUD is cleared once this process is complete, or if there is an AERR. This bit can be cleared by software when set, but only when the UART receiver is idle. Disabling the UART in the CFG register also clears the AUTOBAUD bit

register.name: STAT
register.description: USART Status register. The complete status value can be read here. Writing ones clears some bits in the register. Some bits can be cleared by writing a 1 to them

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag. When 1, indicates that data is available to be read from the receiver buffer. Cleared after a read of the RXDAT or RXDATSTAT

field.name: RXIDLE
field.description: Receiver Idle. When 0, indicates that the receiver is currently in the process of receiving data. When 1, indicates that the receiver is not currently in the process of receiving data

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag. When 1, this bit indicates that data may be written to the transmit buffer. Previous data may still be in the process of being transmitted. Cleared when data is written to TXDAT. Set when the data is moved from the transmit buffer to the transmit shift register

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter Idle. When 0, indicates that the transmitter is currently in the process of sending data.When 1, indicate that the transmitter is not currently in the process of sending data

field.name: CTS
field.description: This bit reflects the current state of the CTS signal, regardless of the setting of the CTSEN bit in the CFG register. This will be the value of the CTS input pin unless loopback mode is enabled

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state is detected for the CTS flag above. This bit is cleared by software

field.name: TXDISSTAT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Interrupt flag. When 1, this bit indicates that the USART transmitter is fully idle after being disabled via the TXDIS in the CTL register (TXDIS = 1)

field.name: OVERRUNINT
field.description: Overrun Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a new character is received while the receiver buffer is still in use. If this occurs, the newly received character in the shift register is lost

field.name: RXBRK
field.description: Received Break. This bit reflects the current state of the receiver break detection logic. It is set when the Un_RXD pin remains low for 16 bit times. Note that FRAMERRINT will also be set when this condition occurs because the stop bit(s) for the character would be missing. RXBRK is cleared when the Un_RXD pin goes high

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs. Cleared by software

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input. Its purpose is primarily to allow wake-up from Deep-sleep or Power-down mode immediately when a start is detected. Cleared by software

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a character is received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a parity error is detected in a received character

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag. Three samples of received data are taken in order to determine the value of each received data bit, except in synchronous mode. This acts as a noise filter if one sample disagrees. This flag is set when a received data bit contains one disagreeing sample. This could indicate line noise, a baud rate or character format mismatch, or loss of synchronization during data reception

field.name: ABERR
field.description: Autobaud Error. An autobaud error can occur if the BRG counts to its limit before the end of the start bit that is being measured, essentially an autobaud time-out

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: Interrupt Enable read and Set register. Contains an individual interrupt enable bit for each potential USART interrupt. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a received character available to be read from the RXDAT register

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the TXDAT register is available to take another character to transmit

field.name: TXIDLEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter becomes idle (TXIDLE = 1)

field.name: DELTACTSEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a change in the state of the CTS input

field.name: TXDISEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter is fully disabled as indicated by the TXDISINT flag in STAT. See description of the TXDISINT bit for details

field.name: OVERRUNEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an overrun error occurred

field.name: DELTARXBRKEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a change of state has occurred in the detection of a received break condition (break condition asserted or deasserted)

field.name: STARTEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a received start bit has been detected

field.name: FRAMERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a framing error has been detected

field.name: PARITYERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a parity error has been detected

field.name: RXNOISEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when noise is detected

field.name: ABERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an autobaud error occurs

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear register. Allows clearing any combination of bits in the INTENSET register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit to be cleared

field.name: RXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

field.name: TXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

field.name: TXIDLECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

field.name: DELTACTSCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

field.name: TXDISINTCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

field.name: OVERRUNCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

field.name: DELTARXBRKCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

field.name: STARTCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

field.name: FRAMERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

field.name: PARITYERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

field.name: RXNOISECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

field.name: ABERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register

register.name: RXDAT
register.description: Receiver Data register. Contains the last character received

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings

register.name: RXDATSTAT
register.description: Receiver Data with Status register. Combines the last character received with the current USART receive status. Allows DMA or software to recover incoming data and status together

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings

field.name: FRAMERR
field.description: Framing Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will set when the character in RXDAT was received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source

field.name: PARITYERR
field.description: Parity Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will be set when a parity error is detected in a received character

field.name: RXNOISE
field.description: Received Noise flag. See description of the RXNOISEINT bit in Table 177

register.name: TXDAT
register.description: Transmit Data register. Data to be transmitted is written here

field.name: TXDAT
field.description: Writing to the USART Transmit Data Register causes the data to be transmitted as soon as the transmit shift register is available and any conditions for transmitting data are met: CTS low (if CTSEN bit = 1), TXDIS bit = 0

register.name: BRG
register.description: Baud Rate Generator register. 16-bit integer baud rate divisor value

field.name: BRGVAL
field.description: This value is used to divide the USART input clock to determine the baud rate, based on the input clock from the FRG. 0 = The FRG clock is used directly by the USART function. 1 = The FRG clock is divided by 2 before use by the USART function. 2 = The FRG clock is divided by 3 before use by the USART function. ... 0xFFFF = The FRG clock is divided by 65,536 before use by the USART function

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt status register. Reflects interrupts that are currently enabled

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter idle status

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of the CTS input is detected

field.name: TXDISINT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Interrupt flag

field.name: OVERRUNINT
field.description: Overrun Error interrupt flag

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag

field.name: ABERR
field.description: Autobaud Error flag

register.name: OSR
register.description: Oversample selection register for asynchronous communication

field.name: OSRVAL
field.description: Oversample Selection Value. 0 to 3 = not supported 0x4 = 5 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. 0x5 = 6 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. ... 0xF= 16 peripheral clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit

register.name: ADDR
register.description: Address register for automatic address matching

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: 8-bit address used with automatic address matching. Used when address detection is enabled (ADDRDET in CTL = 1) and automatic address matching is enabled (AUTOADDR in CFG = 1)
